intro: Draba uralensis, commonly known as the Ural whitlow, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Eurasia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Draba uralensis is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
